responsibilities: Design, build, and launch scalable ML and data processing systems supporting multi-machine data processing, GPU/TPU model training, and automated model monitoring systems on cloud platforms.
Automate model lifecycle management, including training, evaluation, and deployment, to enable fast, safe, and consistent updates across environments.
Introduce modern, scalable frameworks for model monitoring, feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and continuous re-training.
Lead the deployment of models through REST and gRPC APIs for smooth integration with application frontends and real-time user interaction.
Continuously research, evaluate, and implement the latest MLOps tools, frameworks, and platforms.
Implement and manage monitoring systems to track model and data performance, using tools like Prometheus and Grafana.
Apply best practices in secure data handling and model integrity within ML workflows.
Share MLOps knowledge and improvements in ML engineering workflows through internal training sessions and presentations.
Support the next phase of ML pipeline development, focusing on building, maintaining, and monitoring pipelines to handle increased data volume.
qualifications: Ability to exude ambitious, collaborative, and empathetic values.
High standards for quality and passion for the field.
Agility in moving between rapid prototyping and stable production development.
Proficiency in writing design documents, performing code reviews, and maintaining state-of-the-art engineering practices.
Openness to giving and receiving critical feedback.
Enthusiasm for teamwork and pair work.
Utilization of data and metrics to drive decision-making.
Proactive identification and addressing of bottlenecks in the ML pipeline.
analysis:
The job responsibilities focus on designing, building, and launching scalable machine learning (ML) and data processing systems, automating model lifecycle management, and deploying models through APIs. The responsibilities also include introducing modern frameworks for model monitoring, feature engineering, hyperparameter tuning, and continuous re-training. Additionally, the job involves researching and implementing the latest MLOps tools and frameworks, and managing monitoring systems for model and data performance.

The skills required emphasize high standards for quality, agility in development, proficiency in engineering practices, and teamwork. There is no specific mention of working with Generative AI (GenAI) or language models (LLMs) in the responsibilities or skills. The focus is more on general ML systems, MLOps, and data processing rather than on GenAI or LLMs specifically.

While the job involves ML and data processing, there is no explicit indication that it involves working with Generative AI or language models. The responsibilities and skills do not mention tasks or technologies specifically related to GenAI or LLMs, such as natural language processing, text generation, or working with specific language models like GPT or BERT.
